ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: NHS South West London Clinical Commissioning Group

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: NHS South West London Clinical Commissioning Group

TITLE.P: Community Services across Kingston and Richmond Boroughs

SHORT_DESCR.P: Provision of community services for patients within Kingston and Richmond localities. These service support people to stay well in the community, manage their own health with the right support and avoid stays in hospital. Services work across a wide range of health centres, hospitals, GP surgeries, children’s centres, local council facilities and in community settings – including in people’s homes.

MAIN_SITE.P: London Borough of Richmond and Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Provision of a range of NHS Community Adults and Children’s Services for patients within Kingston and Richmond localities. These services support people to stay well in the community, manage their own health with the right support and avoid stays in hospital. Services work across a wide range of health centres, hospitals, GP surgeries, children’s centres, local council facilities and in community settings – including in people’s homes. Includes the provision of Public Health commissioned services being funded by the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames and Achieving for Children, these being: School Nursing Services (Kingston), Sexual Health Services (Kingston) and Reablement Services (Kingston).

INFO_ADD.P: The contracting authority awarding the contract is NHS South London Clinical Commissioning Group (CCG), using NHS commissioning funding, with the addition of local government funding being transferred to the CCG — coming specifically from The Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames (https://www.kingston.gov.uk), and Achieving for Children (https://www.achievingforchildren.org.uk)

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: SWLCCGs strategic direction is to have a single community service offer across Kingston and Richmond (K&R) supported by a single contract. Taking account of the unprecedented impact of Covid-19, the normal commissioning process has been disrupted and it is no longer possible, both in terms of timescales and in terms of service continuity risk, to conduct a competitive procurement for these services ahead of a new contract start date on 1 April 2021.

Observing its obligations under the NHS (Procurement Patient Choice and Competition)(No 2) Regulations 2013, NHS SWL CCG has assessed the appropriateness to award an interim contract directly through a non-competitive process to the incumbent provider(s), recognising an immediate need to ensure continuity of essential patient services whilst a full review takes place to agree the future provision of these services.

MAIN_FEATURES_AWARD.P: SWLCCGs strategic direction is to have a single community service offer across Kingston and Richmond (K&R) supported by a single contract.
To ensure continuity a direct award of a contract for these services for a period of 1 year plus an option to extend for a further one year (maximum 2 years).

TITLE.P: Community Services across Kingston and Richmond Boroughs

ADDRESS_CONTRACTOR.OFFICIALNAME: NHS Hounslow and Richmond Community Healthcare Trust

INFO_ADD_SUBCONTRACTING.P: Service elements being subcontracted are: Kingston Community Services; Kingston Public Health School Nursing and Sexual Health Services; Kingston Social Care Reablement Service; Kingston & Richmond Specialist Learning Disabilities Services

INFO_ADD.P: The contract value of GBP 95 120 000 is the upper potential contract value, should the 12 month contract be extended in full to 24 months.
The intended contract commencement date is 1 April 2021 for 12 months until 31 March 2022, with rights reserved to extend this until up to 31 March 2023.
